title: Figma Buzz Unveils Configurable Templates, Plugin Access, and Video Trimming to Accelerate Brand Asset Production

paragraphs.content: Figma has introduced three new features in Buzz—configurable templates tied to design systems, plugin access inside Buzz, and video trimming—to enable marketing teams to create on-brand assets faster and at scale. Configurable templates leverage component properties and variable modes, allowing users to expose editable elements like text, images, and colors while locking others for brand consistency. These updates build on Buzz's role as a dedicated space for producing marketing materials such as social graphics and event assets directly from Figma Design. Publishing templates is available on paid plans, with Professional teams limited to five and higher plans offering unlimited options.

paragraphs.content: Plugins in Buzz support integrations with digital asset management systems, translation tools, and animation workflows, reducing context switching for teams. Video trimming provides finer control over imported videos, enabling precise adjustments without external editors. These capabilities emphasize interoperability, such as copying component sets from Figma Design into Buzz for instant template conversion. Buzz's simplified interface and bulk editing tools further streamline workflows for non-designers.

sections.title: Configurable Templates Lock Brand Elements to Design Systems

paragraphs.content: Designers build templates using component properties, variants, booleans, and instance swaps, which Buzz converts into flexible sets preserving design system connections. Nested components in templates remain linked to Figma Design libraries, allowing updates via library publishing and republishing in Buzz. Users browse template sets in grid view, with each variant outlined for easy selection and customization. This setup eliminates the need for numerous static files, as marketers toggle properties directly.

paragraphs.content: Publishing involves reviewing property conflicts, setting details like thumbnails, and ensuring no sync with original Design files post-paste. Updates to nested instances require pulling library changes into the Buzz file before republishing. Real-time customization in Buzz includes editing content, switching layouts, and accessing Design Mode for advanced tweaks. These features prioritize marketing use cases by auditing and hierarchically revealing properties in a lightweight toolbar.

sections.title: Plugins and Video Tools Streamline Marketing Integrations

paragraphs.content: Buzz plugins enable direct access to DAMs for pulling brand-approved images and TMS for localized copy, supporting global campaigns without leaving the app. Teams create and publish internal plugins for custom workflows like asset syncing or motion effects. Video trimming allows adjusting start and end times on imported clips, syncing multiples for collages in marketing assets. Demonstrations show plugins enhancing bulk generation and collaboration.

paragraphs.content: AI tools in Buzz riff on designs by rewriting text, translating, or generating imagery alongside these features. Analysts view Buzz as evolving into a holistic workflow for brand teams, with templates as sources of truth for scaling presence. Future maturity depends on plugin ecosystem growth and governance for large-scale use. Hands-on sessions highlight interoperability with Figma's 2025 suite for end-to-end asset pipelines.
